back: replaced elemets are those where the element's content that is replaced by something that is not directly represented in the document content  img and input elements are replaced elements  example: &ltimg src='example.png/&gt
nonreplaced elements are the majority of HTML elements. There content is presented by the user agent inside a box genreated by the element itself  example: &ltspan&gtnonreplaced&lt/span&gt

block-level elements - generate an element box that fills its parent element's content area and cannot have other elements at its sides inline-level elements - generate an element box within a line of text and do not break up the fow of that line
block-level cannot be contained in inline-level elements in HTML - violation. CSS can change add this behavior:  &ltp&gt&ltem&gtexample&lt/em&gt&lt/p&gt  p {display: inline;}  em {display: block}
&ltlink rel='stylesheet' type='text/css' href='css/html.css' media='all' /&gt  common media attributes: print projection screen all
note: must be placed before other css rules or it won't work at all  &ltstyle type='text/css'&gt @import url(style.css); h1 {color: grey} &lt/style&gt
